      This function prompts the user to input information about a capsule and then calls a controller method to approve it.

      This function prompts the user to confirm and input the project name and duration in months, and then sets the end date for the project using a controller.
      void executeOption​(int option)  
      void finishStage()
      This function finishes the current stage of a project and initiates the next stage by taking input from the user for project name, end date, and estimated amount of months for the next stage.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      void menu()  
      void publishCapsule()
      This function prompts the user to input a project name and capsule ID, and then calls a controller method to publish the capsule with the given parameters.
      void registCapsule()
      This function registers a capsule by taking input from the user and passing it to a controller to add it to a project.
      void registStages()
      This function registers stages for a project by taking input from the user for project name, expected start date, and real start date.
      void searchLessonsWithHastag()  
      void showCapsuleByWorker()
      This function prompts the user to input an employee name, retrieves a message containing capsules associated with that employee from a controller, and prints the message to the console.
      void showCountCapsuleType()
      This function checks if a project exists and shows the count of a specific type of capsule if it does, otherwise it prints a message saying there is no project created yet.
      void showLessonsByStage()
      This function prompts the user to input a project name and select a stage, then calls a controller method to display learned lessons for that project and stage.
      void showProjectWithMostCapsules()  
      void startDates()
      This function prompts the user to confirm the name of a project and sets its start date

      The function converts a string date in the format "dd/MM/yyyy" to a Calendar object.

      • stringsToCalendar

        public java.util.Calendar stringsToCalendar​(java.lang.String date)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The function converts a string date in the format "dd/MM/yyyy" to a Calendar object.
        Parameters:
        date - The date parameter is a string representing a date in the format "dd/MM/yyyy".
        Returns:
        A Calendar object is being returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
